message:
Hi, I have a database of contacts that include mobile numbers with the old format, you know in 2011 there had been a shift in numbers format by adding a new digit. Are there a piece of software that can help me update the numbers automatically without the hassle of Excel tricks?

I imagine there should have been a something to import CSV and do automatic update done. Anyone still aware of a software like that?

Thanks a lot

data.message: Ya Abdo check fe google kan fe app mn etisalat bas ana msh faker esmo
The data is not on a mobile device right now, it's on an excel format that can be exported to CSV or any other format, so it's on desktop not mobile.
طيب افرض ياريس كان فى رقم موبايل فى اخره او فى نصه 010 كدا هيبوظ البيانات

Yes it is possible, Guys, he want to apply this directly on the database file he have, not on his phonebook nor outlook  ,

Can be done easily by doing a VBA script to do the conversion . Excel allow Macro, you can write a simple macro if you remember the formula of the conversion and run it on the numbers column.

فى شاب اسمه رامى محروس عمل حاجة زى كدا 
https://ramymahrous.wordpress.com/2010/03/05/10-to-11/
كانت موجودة فplay store بس مش فاكر الاسم
Abdelrahman Magdy send it to me & I'll change it for you :)
You need to apply these rules to numbers that are of the old length (10 digits I think, so don't apply it to numbers with 11 digits, or you will ruin some correct numbers making them 12 digits long.

Mohamed Sameeh Sharaf: He could append any dummy character at the beginning of all numbers and then find and replace.
e.g. replace x010 with x0100

Don't complicate things. A group of regex will solve it. Here are more details

You want to find 010, followed by 7 digits. You replace the 010 with 0100 and put the 7 digits as-is

Here is how you do it in Python

re.sub(r"010(\d{7})", "0100\1", "0101234567")
=> 01001234567
